description: Episode of Series "Chemical Education Material Study Series". Crystals have plane faces, sharp edges, sharp melting points, and may cleave easily to give new plane surfaces. They also interact with x-rays to produce well-defined diffraction patterns. Experiments are performed in a ripple tank on an unknown crystalline array so that the student sees the principles and measurements by which actual crystal structures are determined. Suitable for upper secondary level.
